Test Name: Hematologic Specified Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization (FISH)
Specimen Type: Bone marrow aspirate, peripheral blood, or paraffin-embedded tissue sections
Purpose: To detect specific chromosomal or genetic abnormalities associated with hematologic diseases such as leukemia and lymphoma.
Container: Sodium heparin or EDTA tube for liquid specimens; formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded tissue block for tissue specimens
Equipment: Fluorescently labeled DNA probes, fluorescence microscope with appropriate filter sets, centrifuge, water bath, incubator, glass slides and coverslips
